--- category: '' date: 2021-03-03 19:02:09 UTC-06:00 description: '' link: '' slug: how-to-cut-and-trim-video tags: 'ffmpeg, guide' title: How To Cut and Trim Video type: text --- The following command is used to trim video in FFmpeg. The stream copy enables to trim video without re-encoding and meanwhile keeps original quality for the output video.

` .. code:: bash ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -ss 00:01:23 -to 00:04:20 -c copy output.mp4 `

System Message: ERROR/3 (<string>, line 18)

Content block expected for the "code" directive; none found.

.. code:: bash

System Message: WARNING/2 (<string>, line 19)

Explicit markup ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.

ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -ss 00:01:23 -to 00:04:20 -c copy output.mp4

-c copy trim via stream copy, which is fast and will not re-encode video.
